Addon.name: Preferences
Addon.FormXML: <Form> <Description>Settings that affect the general appearance and function of Contensive features on the site</Description> <Help>Help Copy</Help> <HelpLink>http://www.contensive.com</HelpLink> <Tab name="Admin" heading="Administration Site Settings" description="Settings that affect the layout and design of the Administration site"> <SiteProperty caption="Header" name="ADMINHEADERHTML" ReadOnly="0" Type="Text" Selector="" Description="This caption appears in the upper left corner of the banner over the administration page">Contensive Administration</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Root Page Function" name="ADMINROOTADDONID" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Selector="[None:0|listid(Add-ons)]" Description="Select an addon to run in the Admin site when no other function is selected"/> <SiteProperty caption="Missing Field Check" name="ALLOWADMINFIELDCHECK" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Description="This feature tests all form responses for missing fields. Clear this checkbox if a 'missing field error' prevents you from submitting a form."/> <SiteProperty caption="HTML Editor Height (px)" name="DefaultFormInputHTMLHeight" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Description="The height of the HTML editor">250</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Text Editor Height (lines)" name="DefaultFormInputTextHeight" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Description="The height of a text block editor">1</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Input Form Width (characters)" name="DefaultFormInputWidth" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Description="The width of form input elements, including text, numeric, date, etc.">60</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Select Field Length Limit (rows)" name="SelectFieldLimit" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Description="The maximum length allowed for a select drop-down field. If this limit is exceeded, an error is generated. If drop-down fields are allowed to grow large, the site performance will be effected.">4000</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Select Field Width Limit (characters)" name="SelectFieldWidthLimit" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Description="The maximum width of the displayable text in a drop-down select field. If a caption is too large, it is truncated.">100</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Editing Lock Time (minutes)" name="EDITLOCKTIMEOUT" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Description="When a record is being edited, it is locked so others can not save over the changes you make. This is the time, in minutes that the system waits for the editor to save or cancel the changes.">5</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Cache" name="AllowBake" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="Uncheck to disable caching. Checking this box helps performance. Uncheck this box if pages or menus do not reflect recent changes">true</SiteProperty> <!-- <FileContent name="adminstyles" caption="Admin Styles" filename="templates\AdminSiteStyles.css" description="These styles are used in the admin site, and will affect all users.">#Content {background-color:white;}</FileContent> <DbQuery caption="Administrators" datasourcename="default" description="This is a list of the last 10 administrators to visit the site">select top 10 ID,Name,DateAdded,FirstName,LastName,Email,Admin,Developer,Visits,LastVisit from ccmembers where admin<>0 order by LastVisit desc;</DbQuery> <DbQuery caption="Total Administrators" datasourcename="default" description="number of administrators">select count(*) from ccmembers where admin<>0</DbQuery> --> </Tab> <Tab name="Security" heading="Security Settings" description="Settings that affect security and authentication"> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Email Login" name="AllowEmailLogin" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, users can login with their password and either their username or email address. (requires version 4.1.453)">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Password-less Login" name="AllowNoPasswordLogin" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, non-content managers can login without a password. Be careful because this makes it easier for someone to guess someone else's login. (requires version 4.1.470)">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Password Email" name="AllowPasswordEmail" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, the login page includes a form for users to request their usernames and passwords by email.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Auto Recognize" name="AllowAutoRecognize" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="This option is only avilable if Auto Login is disabled. When this option is checked, a returning visitor will not be authenticated, but personalization may still work correctly. Use this option if you can not use Auto Login, but want your visitors greeted with personlization.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Auto Login" name="AllowAutoLogin" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, returning users are automatically logged in to the site. Clear this setting if your site contains sections or pages blocked to only certain users, or if your site controls any private or personal information. If this feature is checked, administrations, developers and content managers should take care to always log-out after visiting the site from a public computer. ">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Link Recognize" name="AllowLinkRecognize" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="(v 3.4.165+, When enabled, emails that contain links can be encoded so the reader is automatically recognized by the site when they click a link from the email. Recognized means the site log their visit and track them, but they will not be able to access special rights, like editing. This is a good tool to track email marketing conversion, and a convenient way to invite someone with being intrusive.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Link Login" name="AllowLinkLogin" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="(v 3.4.165+, When enabled, emails that contain links can be encoded so the reader is automatically logged in when the click from the email to the site. Like Link Recognition, this is a convenient feature, however, it posses a security risk and should not be used on sites with sensative material.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Duplicate Usernames" name="ALLOWDUPLICATEUSERNAMES" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, this feature prevents the system from saving user records with duplicate usernames. Clear this checkbox if you need your users to have identical usernames.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Public Registrations" name="AllowMemberJoin" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="If checked, the site registration Add-on is enabled, and the page block option for registration is enabled. A user can then register on your site. Registering means when they can select a username and password to login, and use this to login when they return. The registration form includes the option to join any group marked as public. If this feature is enabled, take care that all sensative groups, such as content manager groups, are NOT marked as public.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Block Form Field Tracking" name="Block Viewing Form Field" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="If checked, the visit tracking system will not save the contents of forms submitted to the site. This may be required to prevent some information like credit card numbers from being stored in the database.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Custom Login Add-on" name="Login Page AddonID" ReadOnly="0" selector="[Default:0|ListID(Add-ons)]" description="You can override the default login with any Add-on. For information on how to create an Add-on with just HTML, in Javascript, or with an ActiveX DLL, see the Contensive Knowledge Base at http://Support.Contensive.com"></SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="Tracking" heading="Activity Tracking" description="Settings that affect how the site tracks user and visitor activity"> <SiteProperty caption="Track Visits" name="AllowVisitTracking" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When a visitor hits a page on the site, a great deal of information is saved about the visit, the viewing, and the visitor. When this option is disabled, only authenticated visits are tracked.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Track Guests" name="track guests" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When true, a new user record is created in People each time a new visitor comes to the site. Track Visits is required. (v4.1.182+)">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Track Guests Without Cookies" name="track guests without cookies" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When true, Track Guests applies to all guests. When false, it applies to just guests using a browser that supports cookies. (v4.1.182+)">true</SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="Compatibility" heading="Compatibility and Legacy Settings" description="Settings that affect older sites programmed using legacy or deprecated techniques"> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Legacy ToolsPanel" name="AllowLegacyToolsPanel" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Description="When un-checked, Page Content headline fields use the h1 tag. When checked, headlines are created with a span tag that includes a ccHeadline class. Unchecked is default. Checked is legacy.">0</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Use Content Watch Link" name="UseContentWatchLink" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, the content watch table may be used to create a link for a page that could not otherwise be determined. This is only appropriate for older sites that do not use the section-template interface.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Content Watch Link Update" name="AllowContentWatchLinkUpdate" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="Content Watch is a method of recording the URLs used for each page. The URL is always recorded when the page is first visited. Check the checkbox to also update content watch every time the content is viewed. On some older sites, menus and internal links are created from the Content Watch records. Clearing the checkbox will stop menu links from changing. This happens when uses use different domain names, or when pages are hit from other URL variations.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Page Headline Field uses ccHeadline" name="PAGEHEADLINEUSECCHEADLINE" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Description="When un-checked, the Page Content headline field uses an h1 tag. When checked, headlines are created with a div tag that includes a ccHeadline class. Unchecked is default. Checked is legacy.">0</SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="Debugging" heading="Debug and Trace Settings" description="Settings that affect debugging and tracing."> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Popup User Errors" name="AllowPopupErrors" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, user errors in the site that are not handled by the page will open a popup window. User errors are conditions like form validation errors or bad username/password.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Popup Trap Errors" name="AllowPopupTraps" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, site errors will result in popup windows for users authenticated to developer accounts.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow TestPoint Logging" name="AllowTestPointLogging" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, calls to the MainClass.TestPoint() call will be logged in the current trace.log file.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow TestPoint Printing" name="AllowTestPointPrinting" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, calls to the MainClass.TestPoint() call display on the public website to developers who have enabled 'verbose reporting' enabled. Note that 'verbose reporting' is a visit property, and will stay with the visit even if the user logs off. This can be used to debug cases that do not apply to authenticated users.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Transaction Log" name="AllowTransactionLog" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, all sql statements run through Contensive will be logged to a transaction log with their execution time. This log grows very quickly, so be careful not to leave this setting checked unattended.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Trap Email" name="AllowTrapEmail" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, all internal Contensive errors will be emailed to the trap email address.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Trap Log" name="AllowTrapLog" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, all internal Contensive errors will be logged in the current trace.log file.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Trap Email Address" name="TrapEmail" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The email address where trap errors will be sent."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Trap Errors" name="TrapErrors" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="If checked, the site will handle all internal errors, logging and emailing as required, then attempt to continue the page without displaying any indication of the error to the visitor. When disabled, the web server's error information is not blocked.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Database Upgrade Level" name="BuildVersion" ReadOnly="1" Type="Text" Selector="" Description="This is the version of your data, not the version of the Contensive software on your server. If this version number is lower then the software version, your may need to run a software upgrade."></SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="Resources" heading="Resource Handling Settings" description="Settings that affect how Contensive handles resources in the resource library."> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Image Resize" name="ImageAllowSFResize" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, images will be automatically resized if you manually change their size on a page. For instance, if you have a 100 pixel x 100 pixel image in the resource library, and you drop it on a page, and reduce it to only 50x50, Contensive will make another image sized to 50x50, and use that image on the page.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Image Resize Algorithm" name="ImageResizeSFAlgorithm" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Selector="[box:0|Triangle:1|Hermite:2|Bell:3|BSpline:4|Lanczos3:5|Mitchell:6|Stretch:7]" Description="When checked, automatically resizing uses this algorithm. Examples of each can be seen at support.contensive.com. The default is Lanczos3, number 5.">5</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Image Update" name="ImageAllowUpdate" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, images that have been updated in the resource library will be automatically updated on the site as well.">true</SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="Housekeeping" heading="Housekeeping Settings" description="Settings that affect how the Contensive background housekeeping process maintains your database, and removes old files and records."> <SiteProperty caption="How many days to keep visit archives" name="ArchiveRecordAgeDays" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Selector="" Description="Set the number of days you wish to keep old visit records. These records are used in reporting to detail the activity of every page hit. The default is 90.">90</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="How many days to keep guest archives" name="ArchivePeopleAgeDays" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Selector="" Description="Set the number of days you wish to keep old guest records. Guests are people records that were created on the site, have no email address, have no username, and have only visited once. These records are used to recognize returning guests, but they can contribute to poor site performance by filling your 'people' content with unnecessary records. The default is 2.">2</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Delete visit records that do not support cookies" name="ArchiveDeleteNoCookie" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="Internet cookies are short text strings that your browser uses to recognize websites. Very few legitimate visitors do not support cookies. Search engine robots/spiders, however, typically do not support cookies. Deleting visit information for visitors that do not support cookies is an effective way of removing search engine robot information from your reports">1</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow file content housekeeping" name="ArchiveAllowFileClean" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, the housekeep process will go through all folders in the content files path and delete files that are not associated correctly to database records. The only paths that are checked are those created through Contensive, and that have the table name, fieldname and recordid encoded in the path">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Archive Time-of-Day" name="ArchiveTimeOfDay" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The time what archiving should be run. Only the time portion of the entry is used.">2:00:00 AM</SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="Page" heading="Page Settings" description="Settings that affect how Contensive handles pages on the site."> <SiteProperty caption="Page Return Path Delimiter" name="BreadCrumbDelimiter" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="This string is used between parent pages in the return path (break crumb), when it is enabled on a page.">&nbsp;&gt;&nbsp;</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Site-wide Page Footer" name="PageContentMessageFooter" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="A short 250 character string that appears at the bottom of every page marked to include the message footer feature.">&nbsp;&gt;&nbsp;</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Default Page Name" name="ServerPageDefault" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The name of the physical page on the server that is used when no page is referenced. This should match the server configuration. For instance, if you are using classic asp, and a user types www.MySite.com, the page that will be viewed is default.asp">index.asp</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Default Section Landing Link" name="SectionLandingLink" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="This is the physical URL of the page that should be used if no template is selected for a page or section.">\index.asp</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Landing Page" name="LandingPageID" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="[Select One:0|listid(Page Content)]" Description="This is the content page that should be used when no page is referenced in the URL. This page is often the Home page for the site, but it may be any page you select. You can alternately select the Landing Page by navigating to the page, editing it and checking the Landing Page checkbox in the control tab.">\index.asp</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Page Not Found Content" name="PageNotFoundPageID" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="[Select One:0|listid(Page Content)]" Description="This is the content page that should be used when a requested page is not found. This includes incorrect URLs, as well as content pages that have been deleted."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Add Page-Not-Founds to Link Forward table" name="LINKFORWARDAUTOINSERT" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, Page-Not-Found (404 errors) are added to the Link Forward table automatically. These records will have a 'Source Link' and will count hits to this link, but will have no 'Destination'. To forward any of these pages to a current page on your site, simply add a 'Destination' link to the Link Forward entry under Settings.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Menu Flyout Character" name="MenuFlyoutIcon" ReadOnly="false" Type="text" Selector="" Description="When menu entries contain child menus, this text string is displayed in the entry.">&#187;</SiteProperty> <CopyContent caption="Default Content Block Message" name="Content Block Copy" ReadOnly="0" html="true" Description="This is the default message used for any 'content blocked' page on the site. A content blocked page is one that is blocked by enabling blocking right on the page record. You can override this message on individual pages on the blocking tab of the page."><p>The content on this page has restricted access. If you have a username and password for this system, <a href="?method=login" rel="nofollow">Click Here</a>. For more information, please contact the administrator.</p></CopyContent> </Tab> <Tab name="Email" heading="Email Settings" description="Settings that affect how Contensive sends email."> <SiteProperty caption="Admin Email Address" name="EmailAdmin" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The email address that will be used when the system emails the administrator."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Default Email From Address" name="EmailFromAddress" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The from-address used when emails are sent without a correct from-address. This address is also used when the to-address equals the from-address on a valid email to prevent the email from being stopped by spam services."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Send without Test" name="AllowEmailSendWithoutTest" ReadOnly="false" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When selected, you can send an email without first testing it. When not selected, you must perform a 'send test' before the send button is activated."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Last Email Background Operation" name="EmailServiceLastCheck" ReadOnly="true" Type="text" Selector="" Description="Most email operations occur in the background. This is the time when the last operation occurred. If this time and date is more then a minutes old, there may be a problem processing email."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Use AWS Simple Email Service (SES)" name="AWS Use Amazon SES" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="If checked and the AWS Security Key and Secret Key are entered, the system will send with Amazon SES. Otherwise it will use SMTP."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="AWS Access Key Id" name="AWS Access Key Id" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The Access Key used for Amazon SES Email. To create the key, use AWS IAM to create a user with programmatic access to send SES Email."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="AWS Secret Access Key" name="AWS Secret Access Key" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The AWS Secret Access Key Access Key described above."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="SMTP Mail Server" name="SMTPServer" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The domain name of the SMTP mail server that this site should use when it sends email."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Email Bounce Address (SMTP Only)" name="EmailBounceAddress" ReadOnly="false" Type="text" Selector="" Description="When the site sends an email, and there is a problem with delivery, it is returned to this email address. This email address is not visible in the email. If Email Bounce Processing is enabled, the site will fetch all email from this email address and process it appropriately."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Email Spam Footer" name="EMAILSPAMFOOTER" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="This 255 character text string is included at the bottom of each email, giving the recipient a link to unsubscribe to email from this site. To designate the words to be linked, use &lt;link&gt; before the words and &lt;/link&gt; after the words. Only the first 255 characters will be used."></SiteProperty> <CopyContent caption="Spam Footer Click Message" name="EmailSpamFooterClickMessage" ReadOnly="0" html="true" Description="This is the message a user will see when they click the Spam Footer link at the bottom of an email."><p style="text-align: center;"><br><br>You have blocked future emails from our site.</p></CopyContent> <!-- <SiteProperty caption="Allow Email Bounce Processing" name="AllowEmailBounceProcessing" ReadOnly="false" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="Use email bound processing to automatically remove bad email addresses from your database. When enabled, the site will attempt to read all the email from the Email Bounce Address and remove them as instructed."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Bounce Processing Action" name="EMAILBOUNCEPROCESSACTION" ReadOnly="false" Type="integer" Selector="[Do nothing:0|Clear the Allow Group Email field for all matching addresses:1|Clear the email field for all matching addresses:2|Delete the user accounts for all matching addresses:3]" Description="Set the action to be performed when an Email address is identified as invalid by the bounce process."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Email Receive Server (POP)" name="POPServer" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="This is the email server your site will use to receive email bounces, if configured."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Email Bounce Account Username" name="POPServerUsername" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="If you choose to have the site process bounced emails, setup a bounce email address, and set the username of the email account here."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Email Bounce Account Password" name="POPServerPassword" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="If you choose to have the site process bounced emails, setup a bounce email address, and set the password of the email account here."></SiteProperty> --> </Tab> <Tab name="Site" heading="Site Settings" description="Settings that affect the entire site."> <SiteProperty caption="Default Route" name="Default Route AddonId" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="[Select One:0|listid(add-ons)]" Description="(versiion 5.0) For a typical application, this is the applications main addon. It is executed when no the request to the server does not specify any other command. For example, in the default application website, this is set to the Page Manager which creates an editable website."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Link Alias" name="AllowLinkAlias" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, Contensive produces links in a user friendly format similar to the page name.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Auto HTML Formatting" name="AutoHTMLFormatting" ReadOnly="false" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, the HTML assembled by Contensive is reflowed with tabs and linefeeds to be more human-readable.">&#187;</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Default Wrapper" name="DefaultWrapperID" ReadOnly="false" Type="Lookup" Selector="[None:0|ListID(Wrappers)]" Description="Select a wrapper you want to use as a default for all cases where you have not set the wrapper on an Add-on."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Login Icon" name="AllowLoginIcon" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, a login icon will appear automatically in the lower right corner of the public site. Uncheck this box to remove the icon.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Login Icon" name="LoginIconFilename" ReadOnly="0" Type="ImageFile" Selector="" Description="When Allow Login Icon is checked, this image will appear as a login link in the lower right corner of the public website. When clicked, this icon links to the login form."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Favicon" name="FaviconFilename" ReadOnly="0" Type="ImageFile" Selector="" Description="This image is used as the icon for browsers and shortcuts."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Robots.txt" name="RobotsTxtFilename" ReadOnly="0" Type="TextFile" Selector="" Description="The Robots.txt file is a type of map used by Search engines to understand what physical pages and paths of the website they should be visiting, and should not be visiting. Since the pages of a Contensive website are virtual pages, not actual physical pages, the robots.txt file is less important. Use it to block the admin path. To block content from serach engines, use the blocking tab on the content page or section to block search engine robots. This uses a Meta tag instead.&lt;br&gt;User-agent: *&lt;br&gt;Disallow: /admin/&lt;br&gt;Disallow: /images/"></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Anonymous User Access" name="AnonymousUserResponseID" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Selector="[Allow Access:0|Login Form:1|Custom Block Form:2]" Description="This setting determines what users see when they are not logged in. Set Allow Access for public websites. Set Login Form for Intranets and Extranets. Set Custom Block for a temporary message that prevents guests from reaching the site."></SiteProperty> <CopyContent caption="Anonymous User Blocking Page" name="AnonymousUserResponseCopy" ReadOnly="0" html="true" Description="When Anonymous User Response is set to Custom Block Form, guests to the site see this content for all pages."><p style="text-align:center;margin-top:100px;">This site is not available for anonymous access.</p></CopyContent> </Tab> <Tab name="Templates" heading="Template Settings" description="Settings that affect page templates."> <SiteProperty caption="Default Template" name="Default TemplateId" ReadOnly="false" Type="Lookup" Selector="[ListID(Page Templates)]" Description="When a webpage is displayd in Page Manager as template is selected automatically. The system checks the page record, then the page's parent records, then the domain name record, then it checks this setting. If non of these are set, it uses the most recent template record."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="DocType Declaration" name="DocTypeDeclaration" ReadOnly="false" Type="text" Selector="" EditorAddon="" Description="This is the DocType presented at the top of every page on the site."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Content Type (default)" name="Template Entity-Header Content-Type" ReadOnly="false" Type="text" Selector="" EditorAddon="" Description="The default value for Content-Type returned in the response entity-header and in equivalant meta tag. Typically 'text/html; charset=utf-8'. Overridden by template record, or programmatically with cp.response.addHeader('Content-Type','text/html; charset=utf-8')">text/html; charset=utf-8</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Content Language (default)" name="Template Entity-Header Content-Language" ReadOnly="false" Type="text" Selector="" EditorAddon="" Description="The Content-Language returned in the response entity-header and in equivalant meta tag. Typically 'en-us'. Overridden by template record, or programmatically with cp.response.addHeader('Content-Language','en-us').">en-us</SiteProperty> </Tab> </Form>
